answers.answer: Idk about other states or cities... but i do know that if you're in a high risk pregnancy you get more through out your pregnancy...
Depends ... So far I've had 2 and I'm only 14 weeks I will have another around 20 weeks ....
I have one at every appointment

Normally, two to three. But high risk pregnancy usually get one a month or more. I get one once a month for gestational diabetes and they do a small one twice a week during fetal monitoring to check fluid.

I live in Canada and I got 4.. One at 8 weeks,  12 weeks for first trimester screening,  20 weeks for anatomy scan and 34 weeks for growth and position.  I Also got a 3d at 28 weeks but I had to pay for that one.  :)

I had one at 10 weeks, one at 12 weeks when I went to the hospital to find out that my cramps were round ligament pains, one at 17 weeks when I changed my OBGYN, and I'm about to have another one next Friday for my 19 week check...I have really good health insurance through work and I'm from central CT so I suppose it depends on a lot of circumstances. It's always reassuring to see my little sweetie ok and kickIng up a storm.
Usually you got 2 i got gd and i got 1 a week to make sure baby is doing ok

With my first two I only had 1. Third baby I had two because my baby was smaller than he should have been and they wanted to monitor his growth. Turns out I must have ovulated late or something because my due date got bumped back a couple of weeks which was the cause of his small size. 10 1/2 weeks with baby #4 and had a sonogram in the ER due to my hyperemisis and some pain on the left side of my pelvic region and I expect to have another one with my OB around 18 weeks or so when I'll hopefully get to find out if we're having prince #4 or our first princess! I would venture to guess that most insurances allow for a set number of them but then allow others that the Dr may order for medical purposes like a high risk pregnancy or mine where they needed to double check measurements.

question: How many do we ge during a pregnancy?
title: ultrasounds
